parseActivities

private void parseActivities(org.w3c.dom.Element activities,
                             java.lang.String poolId)
Parses XPDL Activities. An Activity element is either an Activity, a Gateway or an Event.

Parameters:
activities - Element in DOM document
poolId - Pool in which workflow processes are located

getLane

private Lane getLane(java.lang.String poolId,
                     org.w3c.dom.Element activity)
Returns the lane of an activity to create. An activity can have a lane assigned; if no lane is assigned, a default lane is created.

Parameters:
poolId - pool where activity is located
activity - activity element in DOM
Returns:
lane object (BPMN). Null if lane is not part of given pool

getSingleElement

private org.w3c.dom.Element getSingleElement(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                             java.lang.String tagName)
Checks if an element with the given name exists as a child of the given element. If exactly one element is found it is returned, otherwise an Exception is thrown.

Parameters:
element - Element which is the parent of the single element to return
tagName - name of the single element to return
Returns:
single element

getElements

                                                             java.lang.String tagName)
Returns all elements with the given name which are child elements of the given element.

Parameters:
element - Element which is the parent of the elements to return
tagName - name of the elements to return
Returns:
ArrayList of Elements

getNameAndId

private java.lang.String[] getNameAndId(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
Checks if the given Element has attributes Name and Id. If they exist, an array of two strings is returned, where the first string in index 0 is the Name and the second string in index 1 is the Id. If Name or Id attribute does not exist, an Exception is thrown.

Parameters:
element - Element where attributes are retrieved
Returns:
String array where index 0 is Name and index 1 is Id
